column1: For emissions in TgS, use: (Fuel Use in EJ) / (GJ/Tonne) * (S %/100) * 1000 * (1 - f_control%)
For nat gas, the factor below is really the emissions rate, not S%
To calibrate S emissions in dev regions, first check PPP/Cap and adjust GDP0 appropriately if changed
If S emissions in region such as Japan (with maxed out controls) does not go down, adjust final S % of pet products

column5: Note that in dev countries, the S% of pet products
is the S% before controls (which include, reducing S%!)

column2: Generally identical for coal (adjusted in some instances to match sectoral inventories)
column4: Gas production emissions taken account of in industrial sector here

column1: S Emissions Control Mid-point GDP_0 (ppp-based GDPcap)

column4: For oil, can use alternative formulation based on S% below

column1: Power-law growth in industrial emissions (as yr^r)
Base year bunker fuel SO2 emissions

column3: ** Using this variable toggles alternative treatement for liquids
